keyword: how many calories are in semen
title: How Many Calories Are in Semen?
meta_description: Discover how many calories are in semen per average ejaculation, including protein, carbs, and other nutrients based on typical composition.
h1: How Many Calories Are in Semen?
assumptions: Average male ejaculation volume of ~3.5 ml; composition includes seminal fluid from prostate and sperm; no additives.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies greatly by individual health, diet, hydration, frequency, and age. Not a significant dietary source; consult professionals for health concerns.

quick_answer.text: An average ejaculation of semen contains about 18 kcal, mostly from proteins and sugars.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Higher fructose from fruit-rich diet (per ejaculation)
Dehydrated sample (concentrated, lower volume but similar nutrients)

faqs.q: How many calories are in one ejaculation of semen?
faqs.a: Approximately 18 kcal for an average 3.5 ml ejaculation.
It contains about 1.5 g protein per ejaculation, but it's not a practical source.
Mainly fructose (~1.2 g per ejaculation) for sperm energy.

faqs.q: Does semen have fat or cholesterol?
faqs.a: Minimal fat (0.3 g) and low cholesterol (~5 mg) per ejaculation.

faqs.q: How does diet affect calories in semen?
faqs.a: Diet can influence fructose and nutrient levels, potentially adding 5+ kcal.
